message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the product with you. I think it's a great opportunity for you to invest in something that will benefit your business. I'm willing to sell it to you for $18,000.

Alice, thank you for the offer, but $18,000 is a bit more than I'm willing to pay. I'm interested in the product, but I can't go above $14,000 at this time. Let's see if we can find some common ground.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $14,000 is your maximum budget. However, I'm still looking for a better deal. I'm willing to meet you halfway and sell the product to you for $16,500. It's a fair price considering the product's value to you and the benefits it will bring to your business.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $16,500 is still a bit high for me. I'm sticking with my offer of $14,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the value of the product and my budget.  I'm hopeful we can reach an agreement.

Bob, I understand your concerns, but I'm not willing to go down to $14,000. I'm willing to make another compromise and offer you the product for $16,000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering the product's value to me. I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment.

Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I'm still a bit too high.  I'm willing to go up to $15,000, which is halfway between our last offers. This is my final offer, and I'm confident you'll find it a fair deal. If we can't agree, I'll have to consider other options.
